intro: Aphanamixis humilis, commonly known as the dwarf sycamore, is a small evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible, orange-colored fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and parks.
